message.content:
Here is an example of how you can use the `openpyxl` library in Python to read data from a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet:
```
import openpyxl

def read_from_spreadsheet(filepath):
    # Open the spreadsheet using openpyxl
    wb = openpyxl.load_workbook(filepath)
    
    # Get the first worksheet in the workbook
    ws = wb.active
    
    # Read the data from the worksheet
    data = []
    for row in ws.iter_rows():
        data.append([cell.value for cell in row])
        
    return data
```
You can then call this function and pass it the filepath of your spreadsheet as an argument to read the data from the spreadsheet. For example:
```
filepath = "path/to/spreadsheet.xlsx"
data = read_from_spreadsheet(filepath)
print(data)
```
This will print a list of lists, where each sublist represents a row in the worksheet and contains the values from each cell in that row. You can then manipulate this data as needed.

Note: This function assumes that your spreadsheet has only one worksheet. If it has multiple worksheets, you will need to modify the code to handle those cases as well.
